description:
This resource is experimental and may be removed in the future! Feedback
is requested if you find this resource useful or if you find any problems
with it.

Creates a general purpose attachment connection to a Block
Storage volume using the OpenStack Block Storage (Cinder) v2 API.
Depending on your Block Storage service configuration, this
resource can assist in attaching a volume to a non-OpenStack resource
such as a bare-metal server or a remote virtual machine in a
different cloud provider.

This does not actually attach a volume to an instance. Please use
the `openstack_compute_volume_attach_v2` resource for that.

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

AttachMode.description:
Specify whether to attach the volume as Read-Only
(`ro`) or Read-Write (`rw`). Only values of `ro` and `rw` are accepted.
If left unspecified, the Block Storage API will apply a default of `rw`.

Device.description:
The device to tell the Block Storage service this
volume will be attached as. This is purely for informational purposes.
You can specify `auto` or a device such as `/dev/vdc`.

HostName.description: The host to attach the volume to.

Initiator.description: The iSCSI initiator string to make the connection.

IpAddress.description: The IP address of the `host_name` above.

Multipath.description: Whether to connect to this volume via multipath.

Region.description:
The region in which to obtain the V2 Block Storage
client. A Block Storage client is needed to create a volume attachment.
If omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this
creates a new volume attachment.

VolumeId.description: The ID of the Volume to attach to an Instance.

Wwnn.description: A wwnn name. Used for Fibre Channel connections.

Wwpn.description:
An array of wwpn strings. Used for Fibre Channel
connections.
